alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe; Franklin; Halifax; Nash; Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 5:54PM EDT until May 23 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Edgecombe, Franklin, Halifax, Nash and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 554 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rocky Mount, Tarboro, Nashville, Louisburg, Wilson, Franklinton, Elm City, Dortches, Bailey, Bunn, Red Oak, Princeville, Sharpsburg, Pinetops, Spring Hope, Whitakers, Macclesfield, Saratoga, Sims and Castalia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
